name: Karl Parkinson
body:
## About
I'm a Software Developer currently studying Computer Science at the [University of Alberta](https://www.cs.ualberta.ca/). My major programming interests include web development, functional programming, compilers, and the Internet of Things. When not in front of a computer I enjoy baseball, basketball, hockey, camping, reading, movies, TV, and live comedy.

## Work
### Invidi Technologies Corporation - Associate Developer, May 2014 - Present
Currently completing an internship with [Invidi Technologies Corporation](http://www.invidi.com/). Working with a small four man team building an automated testing framework designed to ensure the Invidi Advatar platform performs correctly at scale.

Technologies used: Ruby, PostgreSQL, Jenkins CI, Gerrit Code Review, Git.

### Government of Alberta - Summer Student, May 2013 - September 2013
Helped the Operations team ensure a Government of Alberta data center remained secure and in service by completing a variety of maintenance tasks such as installing temperature probes and setting up server racks.

Duties also included explaining technical knowledge to non-technical users while performing tech support and installing video equipment with members of the Video Conference Team

## Projects
### [wifiLock](https://github.com/KarlParkinson/wifiLock)
A wifi controlled deadbolt lock I built using a Spark Core, a servo motor, and lots and lots of duct tape (aka the greatest technology known to man).

### [ScrumBoard](https://github.com/KarlParkinson/ScrumBoard)
A dead simple online Kanban board I built to learn about modern web development tools and techniques. Built on a stack consisting of Rails, jQuery, and PostgreSQL. Deployed to heroku and is currently residing [here.](https://peaceful-reaches-8323.herokuapp.com/)
